labels.analysis: The Rootly MCP Server is designed to enhance incident management workflows by integrating with development IDEs. Its core functionality revolves around automating incident resolution processes, likely through API-driven tools that streamline operations for developers. The server allows for seamless integration with various MCP-compatible editors, suggesting it is tailored for developer productivity within the context of incident response and management. The available tool "Optional Settings" indicates an emphasis on user authentication and server management, which supports operational efficiency.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Operational Efficiency" was chosen because the server's core purpose is to expedite incident resolution within the development environment, which is a fundamental aspect of operational efficiency. The secondary label "Development Tools" was selected due to its integration with MCP-compatible editors and developer-centric functionality. "API Integration" was also included since the server leverages Rootly's API for automation.

server_info_crawled.name: Rootly MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Rootly-AI-Labs/rootly-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Resolve production incidents in under a minute without leaving your IDE. Integrate seamlessly with your favorite MCP-compatible editors to automate incident management using Rootly's powerful API. Enhance your operational efficiency by leveraging dynamically generated tools tailored to your needs.

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Rootly-AI-Labs/rootly-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: rootlyApiToken
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Rootly API token for authenticating with the Rootly API
